thread.title: Mauricio Pochettino demands improvement from Tottenham striker Vincent Janssen: 'He needs to show more'
thread.title_full: Mauricio Pochettino demands improvement from Tottenham striker Vincent Janssen: 'He needs to show more'

author: tom collomosse
title: Mauricio Pochettino demands improvement from Tottenham striker Vincent Janssen: 'He needs to show more'
text:
Friday 17 February 2017 22:30 GMT Click to followES Sport 
Mauricio Pochettino has demanded an improvement from misfiring Tottenham striker Vincent Janssen after leaving the Dutchman out of his squad for the Europa League defeat at Gent. 
An £18 million signing from AZ Alkmaar last summer, Janssen has yet to score from open play for Spurs and looked extremely glum on Thursday after being snubbed by Pochettino. 
With Harry Kane likely to be rested after taking a knock to his knee in Belgium, there could be a chance for Janssen in the FA Cup fifth-round tie at Fulham on Sunday – though Pochettino offered no guarantees to the struggling 22-year-old. 
The Tottenham manager said: “He needs to show more and we will see. Maybe he will have the chance to be on the bench or play from the start against Fulham. Fulham vs Tottenham: FA Cup preview 
“He was out of the squad against Gent and we cannot be sure if he will be in the squad, on the bench or start the game. Performance is always about how the players show their quality, their belief on the training ground. 
“When I select the starting XI and the bench, I try to be fair. It is normal that maybe he (Janssen) needs to show more.” 
Neither Janssen nor Georges-Kevin Nkoudou nor Moussa Sissoko appears to have the trust of Pochettino, despite Tottenham concluding deals worth a possible £60million to sign the trio last summer. Read more Pochettino: Spurs will give Janssen a chance to rebuild his confidence 
The managr certainly has faith in defender Jan Vertonghen, however, and confirmed the Belgian was close to a first-team return. Vertonghen damaged his ankle in the 4-0 win over West Brom last month. 
Pochettino added: “We wanted him to start working with the group on Friday and he has a chance for Sunday.” More about:
